Street light has not worked for the last 3 months it could be dangerously.

item.title: Flickering street light,, 11th July
item.description:
Flickering street light, someone actually placed a black board in front to prevent the flickering into the bedroom, it’s doest’t work, I’m having to close blind to avoid the light flickering into my face in this heat. Please fix the issue or remove the bulb. This will affect people with epilepsy as well. This has been reported several time before
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shawbrooke Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1 button doesn’t work, 11th July

item.title: Left vehicles, 11th July
item.description:
This car and trailer has been left in our road for many weeks at this point. The car is sometimes removed from the flatbed, then put back on the truck. But it’s a nuisance for all residents here as it takes up 2-3 spaces in an already crowded road. No one who lives here owns these vehicles so we would appreciate it you marked them for removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sydney Road, Colney Hatch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Doubletree Hotel coaches causing problems on Rotherhithe Street, 11th July
item.description:
I am writing on behalf of concerned residents to raise ongoing issues regarding coach activity linked to the DoubleTree by Hilton Docklands hotel. Despite previous efforts to engage directly with the hotel, the problems persist, and we now seek the Council’s urgent intervention. We would like to highlight the following three key concerns: 1. Illegal and Hazardous Parking at Night Coaches serving the hotel are regularly parked overnight along Rotherhithe Street, a residential road not designed for such use. This has caused severe congestion, especially for C10 buses attempting to pass through. Please see the attached photo taken today at 9:45pm which show the disruption caused. In some cases, coaches even mount the pavement, posing a danger to pedestrians, especially at night. This is deeply concerning from a safety perspective. 2. Idling Engines and Air Pollution in a Residential Area Every morning, coaches are left idling for prolonged periods outside residential homes. This area includes a children’s playground and is used by families walking to school. The noise and air pollution are unacceptable and raise serious health concerns, particularly for children and elderly residents. 3. Damage to Road Infrastructure and Vibrations in Homes The weight and volume of coach traffic, particularly along Rotherhithe Street, appear to be causing visible deterioration of the road surface. Many residents report feeling regular vibrations in their homes, which we strongly believe are due to the constant passage and parking of heavy vehicles. We have spoken with the hotel’s management who claim no responsibility, stating that the coaches are third-party providers. However, it is clear they are serving hotel guests and their presence is a direct result of the hotel’s operations. We ask that the Council take urgent action to investigate and resolve these issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
